PeachLetter_000.UsEnglish:
I will be waiting at the castle
on the night of the festival.
There is something I'd like to 
give you.
PeachLetter_000.EuEnglish:
I will be waiting at the castle
on the night of the festival.
There is something I'd like to 
give you.
PeachLetter_000.EuDutch:
I will be waiting at the castle
on the night of the festival.
There is something I'd like to 
give you.
PeachLetter_000.UsFrench:
Je vous attendrai au château le 
soir du Festival des Étoiles. J'ai 
quelque chose à vous remettre.
PeachLetter_000.EuFrench:
Je t'attendrai au château le soir 
du festival des éclats d'étoile.
J'ai quelque chose à te donner.
PeachLetter_000.UsSpanish:
En la noche del Festival de las
Estrellas, te espero en el
castillo. Quiero darte algo.
PeachLetter_000.EuSpanish:
La noche del Festival de las
Estrellas, te espero en el
castillo. Quiero darte una
cosa.
PeachLetter_000.EuGerman:
Ich warte am Abend des
Sternenstaubfestes im Schloss
auf dich. Es gibt da etwas, das
ich dir geben möchte.
PeachLetter_000.EuItalian:
Raggiungimi al castello la
sera del Festival delle
Stelle. Ho qualcosa per te.
PeachLetter_000.JpJapanese:
[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]くず[ruby base]祭[ruby top]まつり[ruby end]の[ruby base]夜[ruby top]よる[ruby end]に　お[ruby base]城[ruby top]しろ[ruby end]で[ruby base]待[ruby top]ま[ruby end]ってます。
わたしたい[ruby base]物[ruby top]もの[ruby end]が　あるの。
PeachLetter_000.KrKorean:
별 축제날 밤에
성에서 기다리고 있을게요.
드릴 선물이 있거든요.

PeachLetter_001.UsEnglish:
I'm in a faraway place. But I'm
all right because you're coming
to rescue me!

P.S. I hope this gift will come
in handy.
PeachLetter_001.EuEnglish:
I'm in a faraway place. But I'm
all right because you're coming
to rescue me!

P.S. I hope this gift will come
in handy.
PeachLetter_001.EuDutch:
I'm in a faraway place. But I'm
all right because you're coming
to rescue me!

P.S. I hope this gift will come
in handy.
PeachLetter_001.UsFrench:
Je me trouve en ce moment dans
un endroit très, très lointain, mais
je vais bien! Car je sais que vous
viendrez me sauver!

P.S. J'espère que ce cadeau vous
sera utile.
PeachLetter_001.EuFrench:
Je me trouve en ce moment dans
un endroit très, très lointain,
mais je vais bien!
Car je sais que tu viendras me
sauver!

P.-S.: J'espère que ce que j'ai
joint à cette lettre te sera utile.
PeachLetter_001.UsSpanish:
Ahora estoy muy, muy lejos,
pero no tengo miedo. ¡Estoy
segura de que vendrás a
rescatarme!

P.D.: Espero que este regalo te
sea útil.
PeachLetter_001.EuSpanish:
Ahora estoy muy, muy lejos,
pero no tengo miedo. Estoy
segura de que vendrás a
rescatarme. ¡Confío en ti!

P.D.: Espero que te sea útil lo
que te mando junto a esta carta.
PeachLetter_001.EuGerman:
Ich bin im Moment an einem Ort
ganz weit weg. Aber das ist
schon in Ordnung! Du wirst mich
bestimmt retten kommen.
Ich glaube fest daran!

P.S.: Ich hab dir mit diesem Brief
was mitgeschickt. Ob es dir hilft?
PeachLetter_001.EuItalian:
adesso mi trovo in un posto
sperduto, ma cerco di rimanere
tranquilla... Sono sicura che
presto verrai a salvarmi!

P.S. Chissà se ciò che allego
a questa lettera ti sarà utile...
PeachLetter_001.JpJapanese:
[ruby base]今[ruby top]いま[ruby end]　とてもとても　[ruby base]遠[ruby top]とお[ruby end]いところにいるの。
でも[ruby base]大丈夫[ruby top]だいじょうぶ[ruby end]！　マリオが　きっと
[ruby base]助[ruby top]たす[ruby end]けに[ruby base]来[ruby top]き[ruby end]てくれるって　[ruby base]信[ruby top]しん[ruby end]じてるから！

P.S.　この[ruby base]手紙[ruby top]てがみ[ruby end]と[ruby base]一緒[ruby top]いっしょ[ruby end]に[ruby base]送[ruby top]おく[ruby end]ったもの、
　　　[ruby base]役[ruby top]やく[ruby end]に[ruby base]立[ruby top]た[ruby end]つかしら？
PeachLetter_001.KrKorean:
저는 지금 매우 먼 곳에 있어요.
하지만 괜찮아요! 마리오가
구해 줄 거라 믿으니까요!

P.S. 이 편지와 함께 보내는 물건
       도움이 되면 좋겠어요!

PhantomBossSpiderZone_Kinopio017.UsEnglish: Eek! I'll be eaten![pause] Someone help me!

Bitte hilf mir doch jemand!
PhantomBossSpiderZone_Kinopio017.EuItalian:

[icon Luigi] [setfontcol green]Luigi [setfontcol default]was kidnapped by the

PhantomGalaxy_Kinopio003.UsEnglish:
The brigade members haven't come
back! What are they up to?
PhantomGalaxy_Kinopio003.EuEnglish:
The brigade members haven't come
back! What are they up to?
PhantomGalaxy_Kinopio003.EuDutch:
The brigade members haven't come
back! What are they up to?
PhantomGalaxy_Kinopio003.UsFrench:
Mes hommes ne reviennent pas! 
Mais qu'est ce qu'ils fabriquent?
PhantomGalaxy_Kinopio003.EuFrench:
Je suis sans nouvelles de la brigade...
Qu'est-ce qu'ils fabriquent?...
PhantomGalaxy_Kinopio003.UsSpanish:
¡Los miembros del escuadrón no han
vuelto! ¿Qué estarán haciendo?
PhantomGalaxy_Kinopio003.EuSpanish:
¡Mis subordinados no han vuelto!
¿Qué andarán haciendo?
PhantomGalaxy_Kinopio003.EuGerman:

PhantomGalaxy_Kinopio003.EuItalian:
La truppa non è ancora tornata!
Chissà che le è successo...
PhantomGalaxy_Kinopio003.JpJapanese:
[ruby base]隊員[ruby top]たいいん[ruby end][ruby base]達[ruby top]たち[ruby end]が　[ruby base]戻[ruby top]もど[ruby end]ってきません！
[ruby base]何[ruby top]なに[ruby end]をしてるんでしょうか…
PhantomGalaxy_Kinopio003.KrKorean:
대원들이 돌아오지 않아요!
뭘 하는 걸까요…

Ziele mit dem [icon BlueCursor][setfontcol red] [setfontcol default]auf mich und

PhantomSpaceGraveyardZone_Kinopio016.JpJapanese: ありがとうございます！！

PictureBookChapter1_Page1_000.UsEnglish:
Our story begins a very, very long
time ago with a young girl. One day,
this girl spotted a rusted spaceship
holding a small star child.
PictureBookChapter1_Page1_000.EuEnglish:
Our story begins a very, very long
time ago with a young girl. One day,
this girl spotted a rusted spaceship
holding a small star child.
PictureBookChapter1_Page1_000.EuDutch:
Our story begins a very, very long
time ago with a young girl. One day,
this girl spotted a rusted spaceship
holding a small star child.
PictureBookChapter1_Page1_000.UsFrench:
Il était une fois, il y a fort
longtemps, sur une petite planète
bleue...

Une petite fillette repéra un
vaisseau spatial rouillé. À
l'intérieur vivait un petit enfant
étoile.
PictureBookChapter1_Page1_000.EuFrench:
Il était une fois, il y a très, très
longtemps, sur une petite planète
bleue...
... une fillette découvrit un vieux
vaisseau rouillé.
A l'intérieur vivait un Luma, un petit
enfant étoile.
PictureBookChapter1_Page1_000.UsSpanish:
Nuestra historia comienza hace
mucho, mucho tiempo.

Un día, una muchacha encontró
una nave estelar. En ella vivía
Destello, un ser diminuto.
PictureBookChapter1_Page1_000.EuSpanish:
Esta historia se remonta
a tiempos inmemoriales.

Érase que se era, un diminuto
planeta donde una chica encontró
una nave estelar. En ella vivía
un destello, un ser también diminuto.
PictureBookChapter1_Page1_000.EuGerman:
Diese Geschichte ist schon so lange
her, dass man sich kaum an sie
erinnert.
Auf einem kleinen Stern entdeckte
ein Mädchen ein rostiges
Sternenschiff.
In ihm lebte ein kleines
Sternenkind.
PictureBookChapter1_Page1_000.EuItalian:
Questa storia ebbe luogo
in un tempo molto remoto...
Su un minuscolo pianeta azzurro,
una ragazza trovò una navicella,
abitazione di un piccolo di stella.
PictureBookChapter1_Page1_000.JpJapanese:
それは、[ruby base]気[ruby top]き[ruby end]の[ruby base]遠[ruby top]とお[ruby end]くなるほど、[ruby base]昔[ruby top]むかし[ruby end]の[ruby base]話[ruby top]はなし[ruby end]。

ある[ruby base]小[ruby top]ちい[ruby end]さな[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]で、[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]がさびた[ruby base]星船[ruby top]ほしぶね[ruby end]を[ruby base]見[ruby top]み[ruby end]つけました。
そこには、[ruby base]小[ruby top]ちい[ruby end]さな[ruby base]星の子[ruby top]チコ[ruby end]が[ruby base]住[ruby top]す[ruby end]んでいました。
PictureBookChapter1_Page1_000.KrKorean:
지금부터 까마득한 옛날 이야기를 해 드리겠습니다.
어느 작은 별에서
한 여자 아이가 녹슨 별의 배를 발견했습니다.
그곳에는 작은 치코가 살고 있었습니다.

PictureBookChapter1_Page2_000.UsEnglish:
"What's your name? Are you lost?"
the girl asked the star child.
PictureBookChapter1_Page2_000.EuEnglish:
"What's your name? Are you lost?"
the girl asked the star child.
PictureBookChapter1_Page2_000.EuDutch:
"What's your name? Are you lost?"
the girl asked the star child.
PictureBookChapter1_Page2_000.UsFrench:
"Comment t'appelles-tu? Es-tu
perdu?" demanda-t-elle à l'enfant
étoile.
PictureBookChapter1_Page2_000.EuFrench:
La fillette demanda au Luma:
"Qui es-tu? Et que fais-tu ici?"
PictureBookChapter1_Page2_000.UsSpanish:
La muchacha preguntó a la pequeña
estrella:

—¿Cómo te llamas?
¿Estás perdido?
PictureBookChapter1_Page2_000.EuSpanish:
La chica le preguntó:

—¿Cómo te llamas?
¿Por qué estás aquí?
PictureBookChapter1_Page2_000.EuGerman:
Das Mädchen fragte das
Sternenkind:
"Wer bist du? Was machst du hier?"
Dieses antwortete:
PictureBookChapter1_Page2_000.EuItalian:
"Chi sei? Che fai qui?" chiese
la giovane.
Il piccolo di stella rispose:
"Mi chiamo Sfavillotto."
PictureBookChapter1_Page2_000.JpJapanese:
[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]は、チコに[ruby base]聞[ruby top]き[ruby end]きました。
「あなたは、だあれ？ここで[ruby base]何[ruby top]なに[ruby end]をしているの？」
チコは、[ruby base]言[ruby top]い[ruby end]いました。
PictureBookChapter1_Page2_000.KrKorean:
여자 아이는 치코에게 물었습니다.
「너는 누구야? 여기에서 뭘 하는 거야?」
치코가 대답했습니다.

PictureBookChapter1_Page2_001.UsEnglish:
"I'm Luma, and I'm waiting for Mama.
She's coming for me on a comet!"
said the star child, who had been
waiting day and night.
PictureBookChapter1_Page2_001.EuEnglish:
"I'm Luma, and I'm waiting for Mama.
She's coming for me on a comet!"
said the star child, who had been
waiting day and night.
PictureBookChapter1_Page2_001.EuDutch:
"I'm Luma, and I'm waiting for Mama.
She's coming for me on a comet!"
said the star child, who had been
waiting day and night.
PictureBookChapter1_Page2_001.UsFrench:
"Je m'appelle Chiko, et j'attends 
Maman. Elle va venir me chercher 
sur une comète!" dit l'enfant étoile,
qui attendait sans cesse jour et 
nuit.
PictureBookChapter1_Page2_001.EuFrench:
"J'attends ma maman. Elle doit venir
me chercher avec sa comète."
répondit le Luma qui attendait,
attendait nuit et jour depuis des
lustres.
PictureBookChapter1_Page2_001.UsSpanish:
—Soy Destello, y estoy esperando a
mamá. ¡Vendrá por mí en un
cometa!

Destello llevaba ya esperando
largos días y largas noches.
PictureBookChapter1_Page2_001.EuSpanish:
El destello respondió:

—Espero a mi mamá. Viene hacia
aquí en un cometa.

Y resulta que llevaba ya esperando
largos días y largas noches.
PictureBookChapter1_Page2_001.EuGerman:
"Ich bin Luma und warte auf
meine Mama.
Sie kommt auf dem Rücken eines
Kometen, um mich abzuholen."
Luma wartete schon eine ganze
Weile, Tag und Nacht.
PictureBookChapter1_Page2_001.EuItalian:
"Aspetto la mamma che deve venire
a prendermi con una cometa."
Sfavillotto attese per giorni
e notti.
PictureBookChapter1_Page2_001.JpJapanese:
「ママがくるのを　[ruby base]待[ruby top]ま[ruby end]っているの。
　ほうき[ruby base]星[ruby top]ぼし[ruby end]に[ruby base]乗[ruby top]の[ruby end]って[ruby base]迎[ruby top]むか[ruby end]えにくるの。」
チコは、[ruby base]昼[ruby top]ひる[ruby end]も[ruby base]夜[ruby top]よる[ruby end]も、[ruby base]長[ruby top]なが[ruby end]い[ruby base]間[ruby top]あいだ[ruby end]まち[ruby base]続[ruby top]つづ[ruby end]けていると[ruby base]言[ruby top]い[ruby end]うのです。
PictureBookChapter1_Page2_001.KrKorean:
「엄마가 오는 걸 기다리고 있어.
 별똥별을 타고 나를 데리러 오실 거거든.」
치코는 밤에도 낮에도 기다리고 있었습니다.

PictureBookChapter1_Page3_000.UsEnglish:
"Don't worry. I'll wait with you,"
the little girl promised Luma.
PictureBookChapter1_Page3_000.EuEnglish:
"Don't worry. I'll wait with you,"
the little girl promised Luma.
PictureBookChapter1_Page3_000.EuDutch:
"Don't worry. I'll wait with you,"
the little girl promised Luma.
PictureBookChapter1_Page3_000.UsFrench:
"Ne t'inquiète pas. J'attendrai avec
toi," lui promit la petite fillette.
PictureBookChapter1_Page3_000.EuFrench:
"Ne t'inquiète pas, je vais t'aider
à chercher ta maman." lui promit
solennellement la fillette.
PictureBookChapter1_Page3_000.UsSpanish:
La muchacha hizo una promesa a
Destello:

—No te preocupes. Esperaré
contigo.
PictureBookChapter1_Page3_000.EuSpanish:
Entonces, la chica hizo
una promesa solemne:

—Te ayudaré a buscar a tu mamá.
PictureBookChapter1_Page3_000.EuGerman:
"Oh. Ich werde den Himmel für dich
absuchen. Vielleicht finden wir so
deine Mama", versprach das
Mädchen.
PictureBookChapter1_Page3_000.EuItalian:
"Ho capito. Allora ti aiuterò a cerca-
re la mamma" promise la ragazza.
PictureBookChapter1_Page3_000.JpJapanese:
「わかったわ、[ruby base]一緒[ruby top]いっしょ[ruby end]にママをさがしてあげる。」
[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]は、チコと[ruby base]指切[ruby top]ゆびき[ruby end]りをしました。
PictureBookChapter1_Page3_000.KrKorean:
「그럼 나도 네 엄마를 함께 기다려 줄게.」
여자 아이는 새끼손가락을 걸고 약속했습니다.

PictureBookChapter1_Page4_000.UsEnglish:
At nightfall, the little girl borrowed
her father's telescope and peered
into the sky. She looked and looked,
but she saw nothing. Hours turned
into days and then years, but still
the sky revealed nothing.
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_000.EuEnglish:
At nightfall, the little girl borrowed
her father's telescope and peered
into the sky. She looked and looked,
but she saw nothing. Hours turned
into days and then years, but still
the sky revealed nothing.
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_000.EuDutch:
At nightfall, the little girl borrowed
her father's telescope and peered
into the sky. She looked and looked,
but she saw nothing. Hours turned
into days and then years, but still
the sky revealed nothing.
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_000.UsFrench:
À la tombée de nuit, la petite fillette
emprunta le téléscope de son père
et scruta le firmament. Elle eut beau
regarder pendant des heures, elle ne
vit rien. Elle attendit des heures,
des jours, des années, mais le ciel
obstiné ne dévoila rien.
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_000.EuFrench:
La nuit tombée, la fillette emprunta
en cachette le télescope de son père
et se mit à scruter le firmament.
Mais elle eut beau chercher pendant
des heures, elle ne découvrit aucune
trace de la comète. Elle essaya
encore pendant les jours, puis les
années qui suivirent...
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_000.UsSpanish:
Cuando cayó la noche, la muchacha
tomó prestado el telescopio de su
padre y observó el cielo. 
Por desgracia, por mucho que mirara
al firmamento, el cometa que
buscaban no aparecía.
Pasaron los días, las semanas, y los
años, pero seguía sin aparecer.
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_000.EuSpanish:
Al caer la noche, sacó a hurtadillas
el telescopio de su papá y lo apuntó
hacia el cielo.
Desgraciadamente, por mucho que
mirara al firmamento, el cometa que
buscaban no aparecía.
Pasaron los días, las semanas y los
años, pero seguía sin aparecer.
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_000.EuGerman:
Als es Nacht wurde, nahm das
Mädchen das Teleskop seines
Vaters und richtete es auf den
Sternenhimmel.
Stundenlang suchte es den Himmel
ab, aber den Kometen von Lumas
Mama sah das Mädchen nicht.
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_000.EuItalian:
Quella sera, la giovane prese di
nascosto il telescopio del padre.
Rimase per ore ad osservare il cielo,
ma non riuscì a scorgere la cometa.
Attese per giorni... E ancora per
anni... Ma la cometa non apparve.
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_000.JpJapanese:
[ruby base]夜[ruby top]よる[ruby end]になると、[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]はこっそりパパの[ruby base]望遠鏡[ruby top]ぼうえんきょう[ruby end]を
[ruby base]持[ruby top]も[ruby end]ち[ruby base]出[ruby top]だ[ruby end]して、[ruby base]星空[ruby top]ほしぞら[ruby end]にむけました。

しかし、[ruby base]望遠鏡[ruby top]ぼうえんきょう[ruby end]を[ruby base]何時間[ruby top]なんじかん[ruby end]のぞいていても
ママのほうき[ruby base]星[ruby top]ぼし[ruby end]は、あらわれません。
[ruby base]何日[ruby top]なんにち[ruby end]まっても、[ruby base]何年[ruby top]なんねん[ruby end]まっても　あらわれません。
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_000.KrKorean:
밤이 되자 여자 아이는 아빠의 망원경을
몰래 꺼내 들고 별하늘을 비추어 보았습니다.

하지만 아무리 오랫동안 망원경을 바라봐도
엄마의 별똥별은 보이지 않았습니다.
며칠이 지나도 몇 년이 지나도 보이지 않았습니다.

PictureBookChapter1_Page4_001.UsEnglish:
Finally, the little girl sighed and said
to Luma, "If we stay here looking
much longer, I'll be an old lady soon."

But then she had an idea.
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_001.EuEnglish:
Finally, the little girl sighed and said
to Luma, "If we stay here looking
much longer, I'll be an old lady soon."

But then she had an idea.
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_001.EuDutch:
Finally, the little girl sighed and said
to Luma, "If we stay here looking
much longer, I'll be an old lady soon."

But then she had an idea.
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_001.UsFrench:
Finalement, la petite fillette soupira 
et dit à Chiko,"Si on continue de 
même, on attendra jusqu'à ce que je
sois une grand-mère."

Disant cela, elle eut une idée.
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_001.EuFrench:
... mais les cieux restaient
désespérément vides.
Un jour, la fillette dit au Luma:
"Si ça continue comme ça, je serai
grand-mère avant qu'on la trouve!"
Et elle poussa un grand soupir...
Mais soudain, elle eut une idée.
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_001.UsSpanish:
Al final, la muchacha le dijo a
Destello entre suspiro y suspiro:

—Acabaré cumpliendo más de
cien años si nos quedamos aquí
esperando.

Entonces tuvo una idea.
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_001.EuSpanish:
Al final, la chica le dijo al destello
entre suspiro y suspiro:

—Voy a acabar cumpliendo más de
cien años si nos quedamos aquí
esperando.

Entonces propuso lo siguiente:
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_001.EuGerman:
Und so wartete es mit Luma Tage,
aus denen schließlich Jahre
wurden. Aber vergebens.
Das Mädchen sagte seufzend zu
Luma: "Weißt du, wenn das so
weitergeht, werde ich hierüber noch
eine alte Oma."
Doch dann hatte es eine Idee.
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_001.EuItalian:
"Potremmo continuare ad aspettare
finché non diventeremo vecchi!"
disse la giovane a Sfavillotto.
E sospirando prese una decisione.
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_001.JpJapanese:
[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]は、チコに[ruby base]言[ruby top]い[ruby end]いました。
「このまま[ruby base]待[ruby top]ま[ruby end]っていたら
　わたしは、おばあさんになってしまうわ。」
ため[ruby base]息[ruby top]いき[ruby end]まじりに、そう[ruby base]言[ruby top]い[ruby end]うと　ある[ruby base]提案[ruby top]ていあん[ruby end]をしました。
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_001.KrKorean:
여자 아이는 한숨 섞인 말투로 이렇게 말했습니다.
「이대로 계속 기다리다간
 나는 할머니가 될지도 몰라.」
그리고는 이렇게 말했습니다.

PictureBookChapter1_Page4_002.UsEnglish:
"Why don't we go out there and find
your mother ourselves?"
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_002.EuEnglish:
"Why don't we go out there and find
your mother ourselves?"
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_002.EuDutch:
"Why don't we go out there and find
your mother ourselves?"
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_002.UsFrench:
"C'est nous qui irons à la rencontre
de ta maman! Pourquoi pas la
trouver nous-mêmes?"
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_002.EuFrench:
"Et si nous partions à la rencontre
de ta maman?"
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_002.UsSpanish:
—¡Vamos a buscar a tu mamá
nosotros mismos!
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_002.EuItalian:
"Saremo noi ad andare incontro alla
mamma, invece che aspettarla!"
PictureBookChapter1_Page4_002.JpJapanese: 「こちらから　ママに[ruby base]会[ruby top]あ[ruby end]いに[ruby base]行[ruby top]い[ruby end]きましょう！」

PictureBookChapter1_Page5_000.UsEnglish:
The girl and Luma fixed up the rusty
spaceship, and then the two set sail
into the starry sky.

And this is how the search for the
celestial mother began.
PictureBookChapter1_Page5_000.EuEnglish:
The girl and Luma fixed up the rusty
spaceship, and then the two set sail
into the starry sky.

And this is how the search for the
celestial mother began.
PictureBookChapter1_Page5_000.EuDutch:
The girl and Luma fixed up the rusty
spaceship, and then the two set sail
into the starry sky.

And this is how the search for the
celestial mother began.
PictureBookChapter1_Page5_000.UsFrench:
La fillette et Chiko réparèrent le 
vaisseau spatial rouillé, et les deux
embarquèrent en direction des
étoiles. 

C'est ainsi que débuta la recherche 
pour la mère céleste.
PictureBookChapter1_Page5_000.EuFrench:
La fillette et le Luma remirent
le vieux vaisseau en état et
embarquèrent en direction des
étoiles.
C'est ainsi que débuta leur voyage
à la recherche de la maman du Luma.
PictureBookChapter1_Page5_000.UsSpanish:
La muchacha y Destello arreglaron la
oxidada nave estelar y pusieron
rumbo al cielo estrellado.

Y así fue cómo comenzó la búsqueda
de la madre de Destello.
PictureBookChapter1_Page5_000.EuSpanish:
Dicho y hecho.
En cuanto el destello y
la chica dejaron la nave
como los chorros del oro,
partieron hacia el espacio exterior.
PictureBookChapter1_Page5_000.EuGerman:
Zusammen mit Luma brachte das
Mädchen das Sternenschiff wieder
auf Hochglanz.
Und bald bestiegen sie das Schiff
und machten sich auf die Reise
zu den Sternen.

Die Suche nach Lumas Mama hatte
begonnen.
PictureBookChapter1_Page5_000.EuItalian:
La ragazza e Sfavillotto tirarono
a lucido la navicella e partirono.
Iniziarono così il loro viaggio nel
mondo stellato in cerca della mamma.
PictureBookChapter1_Page5_000.JpJapanese:
[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]は、チコと[ruby base]一緒[ruby top]いっしょ[ruby end]に[ruby base]星船[ruby top]ほしぶね[ruby end]をピカピカにみがくと
[ruby base]船[ruby top]ふね[ruby end]に[ruby base]乗[ruby top]の[ruby end]り[ruby base]込[ruby top]こ[ruby end]んで、[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]の[ruby base]世界[ruby top]せかい[ruby end]へ[ruby base]出発[ruby top]しゅっぱつ[ruby end]しました。

ママをさがす[ruby base]旅[ruby top]たび[ruby end]の　はじまりです。
PictureBookChapter1_Page5_000.KrKorean:
여자 아이는 치코와 함께 별의 배를 반짝반짝 닦고
배에 올라타 별의 세계로 출발했습니다.

엄마를 찾는 여행은 이렇게 시작되었습니다.

PictureBookChapter1_Title.JpJapanese:
[ruby base]第一章[ruby top]だいいっしょう[ruby end]
-ふたり-

PictureBookChapter2_Page1_000.UsEnglish:
Days passed with no sight of the
comet, or even a single planet.
Instead, asteroids extended for as
far as the eye could see.
PictureBookChapter2_Page1_000.EuEnglish:
Days passed with no sight of the
comet, or even a single planet.
Instead, asteroids extended for as
far as the eye could see.
PictureBookChapter2_Page1_000.EuDutch:
Days passed with no sight of the
comet, or even a single planet.
Instead, asteroids extended for as
far as the eye could see.
PictureBookChapter2_Page1_000.UsFrench:
Des jours passèrent sans qu'ils ne
vissent ni la comète, ni la moindre 
planète. À leur place, des astéroïdes
s'étendaient à perte de vue.
PictureBookChapter2_Page1_000.EuFrench:
Plusieurs jours avaient passé depuis
le départ, mais ils n'avaient pas
croisé la moindre planète sur leur
route. Les astéroïdes et les débris
cosmiques s'étendaient à perte de
vue.
PictureBookChapter2_Page1_000.UsSpanish:
Los días pasaban sin rastro del
cometa, ni de un solo planeta.

En su lugar, solo se podían ver
asteroides tan lejos como
alcanzaba la vista.
PictureBookChapter2_Page1_000.EuSpanish:
Ya han pasado varios días desde
el comienzo de la travesía.

Desafortunadamente, no han logrado
encontrar a mamá, y es más,
ni siquiera se han cruzado con
planetas. Todo son asteroides,
aerolitos y rocas espaciales.
PictureBookChapter2_Page1_000.EuGerman:
Seit dem Beginn ihrer Reise waren 
mehrere Tage vergangen. Aber
bisher hatten sie weder Lumas
Mama noch einen richtigen
Planeten gefunden.
Alles, was sie zu sehen bekamen,
waren trostlose Felsklumpensterne.
PictureBookChapter2_Page1_000.EuItalian:
Passarono diversi giorni dalla
loro partenza...
Non riuscirono a vedere la mamma,
trovando solo pianeti rocciosi...
PictureBookChapter2_Page1_000.JpJapanese:
[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]の[ruby base]世界[ruby top]せかい[ruby end]へ[ruby base]旅立[ruby top]たびだ[ruby end]って、[ruby base]数日[ruby top]すうじつ[ruby end]がたちました。
ママが、みつかるどころか
[ruby base]岩[ruby top]いわ[ruby end]のような[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]ばかりで、[ruby base]惑星[ruby top]わくせい[ruby end]すらみつかりません。
PictureBookChapter2_Page1_000.KrKorean:
별의 세계를 여행한 지 며칠이 지났습니다.
하지만 돌처럼 생긴 별만 보일 뿐
엄마는 물론이고 행성조차 보이지 않습니다.

PictureBookChapter2_Page1_001.UsEnglish:
"If I had known it was going to take
this long, I would have packed more
jam," said the little girl, above the
rumble of her belly.
PictureBookChapter2_Page1_001.EuEnglish:
"If I had known it was going to take
this long, I would have packed more
jam," said the little girl, above the
rumble of her belly.
PictureBookChapter2_Page1_001.EuDutch:
"If I had known it was going to take
this long, I would have packed more
jam," said the little girl, above the
rumble of her belly.
PictureBookChapter2_Page1_001.UsFrench:
"Si j'avais su, j'aurais pris plus de 
confiture," dit la petite fillette en 
frottant son ventre gargouillant.
PictureBookChapter2_Page1_001.EuFrench:
"Si j'avais su, j'aurais emporté plus
de confiture..." dit la fillette en
frottant son ventre qui gargouillait.
PictureBookChapter2_Page1_001.UsSpanish:
—Si hubiera sabido que nos íbamos
a tardar tanto tiempo, habría traído 
más mermelada.

Dijo la muchacha al sentirse
hambrienta.
PictureBookChapter2_Page1_001.EuSpanish:
—¡Vaya! De saber que esto iba
a ser tan aburrido, me habría
traído más chocolatinas.

Dijo la chica al sentir que
su barriguita hacía ruiditos
sospechosos.
PictureBookChapter2_Page1_001.EuGerman:
"Hätte ich gewusst, dass das so
lange dauert, hätte ich mehr
Marmelade mitgebracht...",
sagte das Mädchen, seinen
hungrigen Bauch reibend.
PictureBookChapter2_Page1_001.EuItalian:
"Che fame! Se lo avessi immaginato,
avrei portato più marmellata!" disse
la ragazza.
PictureBookChapter2_Page1_001.JpJapanese:
「こんなことなら、ジャムをもっと[ruby base]持[ruby top]も[ruby end]ってくるんだった・・」
グウグウ[ruby base]鳴[ruby top]な[ruby end]るおなかをさすって、[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]は[ruby base]言[ruby top]い[ruby end]いました。
PictureBookChapter2_Page1_001.KrKorean:
「이렇게 될 줄 알았다면 잼을 더 많이 가져올걸….」
꾸룩꾸룩 소리나는 배를 쓰다듬으며
여자 아이가 말했습니다.

PictureBookChapter2_Page2_000.UsEnglish:
Before they left, she had packed all
the essentials: telescope, butterfly
net, stuffed bunny, bread, milk, jam,
and apricot-flavored tea, but...
PictureBookChapter2_Page2_000.EuEnglish:
Before they left, she had packed all
the essentials: telescope, butterfly
net, stuffed bunny, bread, milk, jam,
and apricot-flavored tea, but...
PictureBookChapter2_Page2_000.EuDutch:
Before they left, she had packed all
the essentials: telescope, butterfly
net, stuffed bunny, bread, milk, jam,
and apricot-flavored tea, but...
PictureBookChapter2_Page2_000.UsFrench:
Avant d'embarquer, elle avait 
rempli son sac avec l'indispensable:
du pain, du lait, de la confiture, le
téléscope de son père, un filet à 
papillons, et un lapin en peluche, 
mais...
PictureBookChapter2_Page2_000.EuFrench:
Avant le départ, elle avait
empaqueté du pain de seigle, du lait,
de la confiture de framboise et du
thé parfumé à l'abricot, mais elle
avait oublié quelque chose
d'essentiel...
PictureBookChapter2_Page2_000.UsSpanish:
Antes de marchar, había preparado
todo lo imprescindible: pan, leche,
mermelada, un telescopio, un
conejito de peluche, una red para
mariposas, y té con sabor a
albaricoque, pero...
PictureBookChapter2_Page2_000.EuSpanish:
Al salir, metió en la mochila pan
integral, leche y chocolate del rico.
Tampoco se le pasaron por alto
los yogures de melocotón.
Pero olvidó lo más importante.
PictureBookChapter2_Page2_000.EuGerman:
Roggenbrot und Milch, Himbeer-
marmelade und schwarzen Tee, der
nach Aprikosen duftete, hatte es in
seinen Rucksack gestopft, doch eine
wesentliche Sache fehlte.
PictureBookChapter2_Page2_000.EuItalian:
Nello zaino aveva infilato pane di
segale, latte, marmellata di lamponi
e tè all'albicocca...
Ma purtroppo non bastavano.
PictureBookChapter2_Page2_000.JpJapanese:
ライ[ruby base]麦[ruby top]むぎ[ruby end]パンとミルク、ラズベリージャム、そして
アプリコットの[ruby base]香[ruby top]かお[ruby end]りのする[ruby base]紅茶[ruby top]こうちゃ[ruby end]を、リュックに
つめてきたのですが、[ruby base]肝心[ruby top]かんじん[ruby end]なものが[ruby base]足[ruby top]た[ruby end]りません。
PictureBookChapter2_Page2_000.KrKorean:
호밀빵과 우유, 라즈베리잼,
그리고 살구 향이 나는 홍차를 배낭 안에
넣어 왔지만, 중요한 걸 잊었습니다.

PictureBookChapter2_Page3_000.UsEnglish:
"I forgot to bring water!"

At this, Luma burst into gales of
laughter, and the girl began to pout.
PictureBookChapter2_Page3_000.EuEnglish:
"I forgot to bring water!"

At this, Luma burst into gales of
laughter, and the girl began to pout.
PictureBookChapter2_Page3_000.EuDutch:
"I forgot to bring water!"

At this, Luma burst into gales of
laughter, and the girl began to pout.
PictureBookChapter2_Page3_000.UsFrench:
"J'ai oublié d'apporter de l'eau!"

À ces mots, Chiko éclata de rire, et
la petite fillette se mit à faire la
baboune.
PictureBookChapter2_Page3_000.EuFrench:
"Je n'ai pas pris d'eau! Ce que je
peux être tête en l'air!"
A ces mots, le Luma se mit à rire
aux éclats.
PictureBookChapter2_Page3_000.UsSpanish:
—¡Olvidé traer agua!

Al oír esto, Destello rompió a reír,
y la muchacha comenzó a hacer
pucheros.
PictureBookChapter2_Page3_000.EuSpanish:
—¡Qué descuido! ¡No he traído agua!

El destello no pudo evitar soltar
una prolongada risa al ver
a la chica tan cabizbaja.
PictureBookChapter2_Page3_000.EuGerman:
"Wie konnte ich nur Wasser
vergessen, ich Schussel?!?", sagte
es und ließ den Kopf hängen. Als
Luma das sah, musste er laut lachen.
PictureBookChapter2_Page3_000.EuItalian:
"Come ho potuto dimenticare l'ac-
qua!" disse la ragazza arrabbiata.
La sua espressione fece scoppiare
Sfavillotto in una gran risata.
PictureBookChapter2_Page3_000.JpJapanese:
「お[ruby base]水[ruby top]みず[ruby end]を[ruby base]忘[ruby top]わす[ruby end]れるなんて、うっかりしてたわ。」

そう[ruby base]言[ruby top]い[ruby end]ってうなだれる[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]を[ruby base]見[ruby top]み[ruby end]て
チコが[ruby base]大笑[ruby top]おおわら[ruby end]いしました。
PictureBookChapter2_Page3_000.KrKorean:
「물을 안 가져왔어. 나도 참!」

고개를 떨구는 여자 아이를 보고
치코는 큰 소리로 웃었습니다.

PictureBookChapter2_Page3_001.UsEnglish:
"As long as I have Star Bits, I'll be
fine," said Luma. "Want some?"
The little girl couldn't stay mad
after hearing this.
PictureBookChapter2_Page3_001.EuEnglish:
"As long as I have Star Bits, I'll be
fine," said Luma. "Want some?"
The little girl couldn't stay mad
after hearing this.
PictureBookChapter2_Page3_001.EuDutch:
"As long as I have Star Bits, I'll be
fine," said Luma. "Want some?"
The little girl couldn't stay mad
after hearing this.
PictureBookChapter2_Page3_001.UsFrench:
"Tant que j'ai des Éclats d'Étoile, 
ça me suffit," dit Chiko. "Tu en 
veux?"

La petite fillette ne pouvait plus 
être en colère après avoir entendu 
cela.
PictureBookChapter2_Page3_001.EuFrench:
"Moi, tant que j'ai des éclats
d'étoiles, ça me suffit.
Tu veux goûter?"
La fillette répondit avec une pointe
d'ironie:
"Ah, me voilà rassurée. Je pensais
que tu ne riais jamais."
PictureBookChapter2_Page3_001.UsSpanish:
—Estaré bien mientras tenga Trozos 
de Estrellas —dijo Destello—, ¿por
qué no los pruebas?
La muchacha no pudo seguir enojada
después de escuchar esto.
PictureBookChapter2_Page3_001.EuSpanish:
—¡Pues yo me conformo con polvo de
estrellas! ¿Por qué no lo pruebas?

Nada más oír esto, la chica
respondió burlona.

—Por fin consigo que te rías. Estaba
empezando a pensar que no sabías.
PictureBookChapter2_Page3_001.EuGerman:
"Ich bin zufrieden, solange ich nur
meinen Sternenstaub habe.
Wie wär's? Probier doch auch mal."
Darauf entgegnete das Mädchen
bissig: "Ha ha... Das findest du wohl
witzig."
PictureBookChapter2_Page3_001.EuItalian:
"A me bastano le Astroschegge...
A te, no?" Alle parole di Sfavillotto,
la giovane s'indispettì...
PictureBookChapter2_Page3_001.JpJapanese:
「ボクは、[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]くずさえあれば[ruby base]満足[ruby top]まんぞく[ruby end]さ。キミも、どうだい？」

そう[ruby base]言[ruby top]い[ruby end]われると、[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]はイヤミで[ruby base]切[ruby top]き[ruby end]り[ruby base]返[ruby top]かえ[ruby end]しました。
「ああ、よかった。あなた[ruby base]笑[ruby top]わら[ruby end]えないのかと[ruby base]思[ruby top]おも[ruby end]っていたわ。」
PictureBookChapter2_Page3_001.KrKorean:
「나는 별만 있으면 되는데. 너도 먹어 볼래?」

여자 아이는 약이 올라 이렇게 말했습니다.
「다행이야. 너도 웃을 줄 아는구나?」

PictureBookChapter2_Page4_000.UsEnglish:
Luma continued to laugh, and the girl
couldn't help but join in.
PictureBookChapter2_Page4_000.EuEnglish:
Luma continued to laugh, and the girl
couldn't help but join in.
PictureBookChapter2_Page4_000.EuDutch:
Luma continued to laugh, and the girl
couldn't help but join in.
PictureBookChapter2_Page4_000.UsFrench:
Chiko continua à rire, et elle finit 
par rire avec lui.
PictureBookChapter2_Page4_000.EuFrench:
Et le Luma de rire, rire... au point
que la fillette finit par rire avec lui.
PictureBookChapter2_Page4_000.UsSpanish:
Destello continuó riendo, y la
muchacha no pudo evitar reír
también.
PictureBookChapter2_Page4_000.EuSpanish:
El destello reía sin parar, y al final,
la chica se hartó tanto de escuchar
inmóvil, que se le pegó la risa.
PictureBookChapter2_Page4_000.EuGerman:
Aber, wie es ihn so lachen sah, 
wurde das verdutzte Mädchen von 
seinem Lachen angesteckt.
PictureBookChapter2_Page4_000.EuItalian:
Ma vedendo che Sfavillotto non
smetteva, anche lei finì per ridere.
PictureBookChapter2_Page4_000.JpJapanese:
それでも、[ruby base]笑[ruby top]わら[ruby end]い[ruby base]止[ruby top]や[ruby end]まないチコを[ruby base]見[ruby top]み[ruby end]て
あきれた[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]は、もらい[ruby base]笑[ruby top]わら[ruby end]い。
PictureBookChapter2_Page4_000.KrKorean:
그래도 여전히 웃는 치코를 보고
어이가 없어진 여자 아이는 피식 웃고 말았습니다.

PictureBookChapter2_Page4_001.UsFrench:
"Pourquoi pas, mais juste une 
petite bouchée."
PictureBookChapter2_Page4_001.EuFrench:
"Bon, dans ce cas, pourquoi pas!
Je vais en goûter une bouchée."
PictureBookChapter2_Page4_001.UsSpanish:
—De acuerdo, supongo que puedo
probar un poco.
PictureBookChapter2_Page4_001.EuSpanish:
—Ya que lo dices... ¿Por qué no?
No se puede decir que algo está
malo sin probarlo, ¿no?
PictureBookChapter2_Page4_001.EuGerman:
"Du hast Recht, ich nehm mir
mal einen Bissen."
PictureBookChapter2_Page4_001.EuItalian:
"Hmmm... E va bene, allora
le assaggerò anch'io!"
PictureBookChapter2_Page4_001.JpJapanese: 「そうね、ひとかじり　いただくことにするわ。」

PictureBookChapter2_Page5_000.UsEnglish:
Leaning far out of the ship, the pair
began to collect Star Bits with the
girl's net. They almost fell out a few
times, but they kept on collecting.
PictureBookChapter2_Page5_000.EuEnglish:
Leaning far out of the ship, the pair
began to collect Star Bits with the
girl's net. They almost fell out a few
times, but they kept on collecting.
PictureBookChapter2_Page5_000.EuDutch:
Leaning far out of the ship, the pair
began to collect Star Bits with the
girl's net. They almost fell out a few
times, but they kept on collecting.
PictureBookChapter2_Page5_000.UsFrench:
Grâce au filet à papillons, la paire
commenca à attraper des Éclats
d'Étoile en se penchant sur le
vaisseau. Ils faillirent tomber
plus d'une fois, mais ils n'arrêtèrent
pas de les ramasser.
PictureBookChapter2_Page5_000.EuFrench:
Grâce au filet à papillons de
son frère qu'elle avait emporté,
la fillette commença à attraper des
éclats d'étoiles.
Elle se penchait à l'extérieur du
vaisseau pour atteindre les cristaux
scintillants, et faillit en tomber plus
d'une fois!
PictureBookChapter2_Page5_000.UsSpanish:
Con la red para mariposas de la 
muchacha, los dos se asomaron
desde la nave y comenzaron a
recoger Trozos de Estrellas.
Estuvieron a punto de caer varias
veces, pero continuaron.
PictureBookChapter2_Page5_000.EuSpanish:
Entonces, sacó la red de insectos
de su hermano y empezaron a cazar
polvo de estrellas.
Llegó a sacar medio cuerpo fuera y
casi se cae varias veces.
El polvo de estrellas que recogieron
era brillante, reluciente.
PictureBookChapter2_Page5_000.EuGerman:
Es zerrte das Schmetterlingsnetz
seines Bruders aus dem Rucksack
und die beiden begannen, Sternen-
staub zu sammeln. Das Mädchen 
streckte sich dabei aus dem 
Sternenschiff, wobei es mehrmals 
beinahe aus dem Schiff gefallen 
wäre.
PictureBookChapter2_Page5_000.EuItalian:
Usando la retina per farfalle del
fratello, iniziarono la raccolta e,
sporgendosi temerariamente dalla
navicella, presero le Astroschegge.
PictureBookChapter2_Page5_000.JpJapanese:
[ruby base]弟[ruby top]おとうと[ruby end]の[ruby base]虫取[ruby top]むしと[ruby end]りあみを、ひっぱり[ruby base]出[ruby top]だ[ruby end]し
[ruby base]二人[ruby top]ふたり[ruby end]は、[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]くずを[ruby base]取[ruby top]と[ruby end]りはじめました。
[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end][ruby base]船[ruby top]ぶね[ruby end]から[ruby base]体[ruby top]からだ[ruby end]をのりだして、[ruby base]何度[ruby top]なんど[ruby end]か[ruby base]落[ruby top]お[ruby end]ちそうになりながら
キラキラ[ruby base]光[ruby top]ひか[ruby end]る、[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]くずを[ruby base]取[ruby top]と[ruby end]りました。
PictureBookChapter2_Page5_000.KrKorean:
동생의 잠자리채를 꺼내 들고
그들은 별을 잡기 시작했습니다.
별의 배에서 떨어질 듯 아슬아슬하게 몸을 빼고
반짝반짝 빛나는 별을 잡았습니다.

PictureBookChapter2_Page5_001.UsEnglish: The Star Bits tasted like honey.
PictureBookChapter2_Page5_001.EuEnglish: The Star Bits tasted like honey.
PictureBookChapter2_Page5_001.EuDutch: The Star Bits tasted like honey.
PictureBookChapter2_Page5_001.UsFrench:
Lorsqu'ils en eurent attrapé
suffisamment, la fillette en glissa 
une poignée dans sa bouche.

Les Éclats d'Étoile avaient le goût
du miel.
PictureBookChapter2_Page5_001.EuFrench:
Lorsqu'elle en eut attrapé
suffisamment, elle en glissa une
poignée dans sa bouche.
Ils avaient un goût sucré proche du
miel.
PictureBookChapter2_Page5_001.UsSpanish:
Los Trozos de Estrellas sabían como
la miel.
PictureBookChapter2_Page5_001.EuGerman:
Der Sternenstaub schmeckte
wie süßer Honig.
PictureBookChapter2_Page5_001.EuItalian:
Avevano il sapore di un miele
estremamente dolce.
PictureBookChapter2_Page5_001.JpJapanese: それは、あまいハチミツの[ruby base]味[ruby top]あじ[ruby end]がしました。

PictureBookChapter2_Title.JpJapanese:
[ruby base]第二章[ruby top]だいにしょう[ruby end]
-ほしくず-

PictureBookChapter3_Page1_000.UsEnglish:
A beam of light pierced through the
ship's window. Thinking it was the
morning sun, the girl peered through
the window, only to find a turquoise
blue comet shimmering at her.
PictureBookChapter3_Page1_000.EuEnglish:
A beam of light pierced through the
ship's window. Thinking it was the
morning sun, the girl peered through
the window, only to find a turquoise
blue comet shimmering at her.
PictureBookChapter3_Page1_000.EuDutch:
A beam of light pierced through the
ship's window. Thinking it was the
morning sun, the girl peered through
the window, only to find a turquoise
blue comet shimmering at her.
PictureBookChapter3_Page1_000.UsFrench:
Un rayon de lumière pénétra par le 
hublot du vaisseau. Croyant que 
c'était le lever du soleil, la fillette
regarda par la fênetre. Elle aperçut 
une superbe comète, couleur
turquoise, brillant de mille feux.
PictureBookChapter3_Page1_000.EuFrench:
Un jour, un rayon de lumière
pénétra par le hublot du vaisseau.
"Le soleil se lève? Ça faisait
longtemps!"
Et, regardant par la fenêtre, la
fillette aperçut un astre magnifique,
couleur émeraude, brillant de mille
feux.
PictureBookChapter3_Page1_000.UsSpanish:
Un rayo de luz atravesó la ventana
de la nave. Creyendo que era el sol
de la mañana, la muchacha miró por
la ventana y vio un brillante cometa
de color azul turquesa.
PictureBookChapter3_Page1_000.EuSpanish:
Una luz intensa entró por las
redondas ventanas de la nave.

—¿Será el sol?

La chica oteó el exterior y encontró
ante sí un bello cuerpo celeste
teñido de un suave azul cobalto.
PictureBookChapter3_Page1_000.EuGerman:
Durch das runde Fenster des
Sternenschiffes strahlte ein Licht
herein. "Ob das die Morgensonne ist,
die ich schon so lange nicht mehr 
gesehen habe?"
Als das Mädchen aus dem Fenster
blickte, sah es einen wunderschönen,
smaragdfarben leuchtenden Stern.
PictureBookChapter3_Page1_000.EuItalian:
Dalla finestrella tonda della navicella
filtrò un raggio di luce.
"È da tanto che non vedo sorgere
il sole!" pensò la ragazza.
Ma avvicinandosi alla finestra vide
una meravigliosa cometa azzurra.
PictureBookChapter3_Page1_000.JpJapanese:
[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end][ruby base]船[ruby top]ぶね[ruby end]の[ruby base]丸[ruby top]まる[ruby end]い[ruby base]窓[ruby top]まど[ruby end]から、[ruby base]光[ruby top]ひかり[ruby end]がさしこんできました。
「ひさしぶりの　[ruby base]朝日[ruby top]あさひ[ruby end]かしら。」

[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]が、[ruby base]窓[ruby top]まど[ruby end]をのぞくと
そこにはエメラルド[ruby base]色[ruby top]いろ[ruby end]に[ruby base]輝[ruby top]かがや[ruby end]く、[ruby base]見事[ruby top]みごと[ruby end]な[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]が[ruby base]見[ruby top]み[ruby end]えました。
PictureBookChapter3_Page1_000.KrKorean:
배의 동그란 창 안으로 햇빛이 쏟아졌습니다.
「아침 햇살은 오랜만이야.」

여자 아이는 창밖을 내다보았습니다.
그곳에는 에메랄드 빛을 띤 멋진 별이 있었습니다.

PictureBookChapter3_Page1_001.UsEnglish:
The little girl shook the sleeping
Luma awake and shouted excitedly,
"We HAVE to get to that comet!"
PictureBookChapter3_Page1_001.EuEnglish:
The little girl shook the sleeping
Luma awake and shouted excitedly,
"We HAVE to get to that comet!"
PictureBookChapter3_Page1_001.EuDutch:
The little girl shook the sleeping
Luma awake and shouted excitedly,
"We HAVE to get to that comet!"
PictureBookChapter3_Page1_001.UsFrench:
La petite fillette secoua le Chiko
endormi pour le réveiller et exclama,
"Nous DEVONS atteindre cette 
comète!"
PictureBookChapter3_Page1_001.EuFrench:
Secouant le Luma endormi pour le
réveiller, la fillette lui dit:
"Allons voir ce qu'il y a sur cet
astre!"
PictureBookChapter3_Page1_001.UsSpanish:
La muchacha despertó a Destello y
gritó con emoción:

—¡Tenemos que llegar hasta ese
cometa!
PictureBookChapter3_Page1_001.EuSpanish:
Entonces achuchó repetidamente al
destello para despertarle y dijo:

—¡Vamos a esa estrella!
PictureBookChapter3_Page1_001.EuGerman:
Das Mädchen weckte einen arg
verschlafenen Luma und sagte:

"Komm, lass uns zu dem Stern
gehen und dort aussteigen!"
PictureBookChapter3_Page1_001.EuItalian:
La giovane diede uno scossone
a Sfavillotto per svegliarlo.
"Andiamo a visitare quella cometa!"
gli disse.
PictureBookChapter3_Page1_001.JpJapanese:
[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]は、[ruby base]寝[ruby top]ね[ruby end]ぼけまなこのチコをユサユサゆり[ruby base]起[ruby top]お[ruby end]こすと
[ruby base]言[ruby top]い[ruby end]いました。

「あの、[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]へ[ruby base]行[ruby top]い[ruby end]ってみましょう！」
PictureBookChapter3_Page1_001.KrKorean:
여자 아이는 잠이 덜 깬 치코를
흔들흔들 깨우고는 말했습니다.

「저 별에 가 보자!」

PictureBookChapter3_Page2_000.UsEnglish:
The pair descended on the comet
and found that it was made of ice. 
They looked high and low, but Luma's
mother was nowhere to be found.
PictureBookChapter3_Page2_000.EuEnglish:
The pair descended on the comet
and found that it was made of ice. 
They looked high and low, but Luma's
mother was nowhere to be found.
PictureBookChapter3_Page2_000.EuDutch:
The pair descended on the comet
and found that it was made of ice. 
They looked high and low, but Luma's
mother was nowhere to be found.
PictureBookChapter3_Page2_000.UsFrench:
Ils atterrirent sur la comète et
découvrirent qu'elle était en fait
une comète de glace. Ils fouillèrent
partout, mais ne virent aucune trace
de la Maman de Chiko.
PictureBookChapter3_Page2_000.EuFrench:
Le corps céleste sur lequel ils
avaient atterri semblait fait de glace
lumineuse.
Le Luma et la fillette l'explorèrent
minutieusement, mais ne trouvèrent
aucune trace de la maman du Luma.
PictureBookChapter3_Page2_000.UsSpanish:
Ambos descendieron sobre el
cometa y descubrieron que estaba
hecho de hielo. Buscaron por todas
partes, pero no encontraron a la
madre de Destello.
PictureBookChapter3_Page2_000.EuSpanish:
Nada más pisarla, ella notó que
estaba sobre una gran masa
brillante de hielo.

El destello y la chica la exploraron
por separado, pero ni rastro de
mamá.
PictureBookChapter3_Page2_000.EuGerman:
Der Stern, auf dem sie gelandet
waren, war ganz aus leuchtendem
Eis gemacht.
Luma und das Mädchen liefen umher,
aber Lumas Mama fanden sie nicht.
PictureBookChapter3_Page2_000.EuItalian:
Atterrarono sulla cometa. Era
ricoperta di ghiaccio e risplendeva
di luce. Sfavillotto e la giovane si
divisero alla ricerca della mamma,
ma invano.
PictureBookChapter3_Page2_000.JpJapanese:
[ruby base]降[ruby top]お[ruby end]り[ruby base]立[ruby top]た[ruby end]った[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]は、[ruby base]光[ruby top]ひか[ruby end]る[ruby base]氷[ruby top]こおり[ruby end]でできた[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]でした。

チコと[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]は、[ruby base]手分[ruby top]てわ[ruby end]けして[ruby base]歩[ruby top]ある[ruby end]きまわりましたが
ママの[ruby base]姿[ruby top]すがた[ruby end]はありません。
PictureBookChapter3_Page2_000.KrKorean:
그곳은 반짝이는 얼음으로 만들어진 별이었습니다.

치코와 여자 아이는 열심히 찾아보았지만
엄마의 모습은 보이지 않았습니다.

PictureBookChapter3_Page2_001.UsEnglish:
Exhausted, the little girl sat down
with a flop, utterly unable to take
another step.

"Look!"
PictureBookChapter3_Page2_001.EuEnglish:
Exhausted, the little girl sat down
with a flop, utterly unable to take
another step.

"Look!"
PictureBookChapter3_Page2_001.EuDutch:
Exhausted, the little girl sat down
with a flop, utterly unable to take
another step.

"Look!"
PictureBookChapter3_Page2_001.UsFrench:
Épuisée, la petite fillette tomba
assise, carrément incapable de faire
un seul pas de plus.

"Regarde!"
PictureBookChapter3_Page2_001.EuFrench:
Exténuée, la fillette se laissa choir
sur le sol.
"On dirait que ta maman n'est pas
ici..."
Soudain, le Luma s'écria:
"Regarde!"
PictureBookChapter3_Page2_001.UsSpanish:
Agotada, la muchacha se sentó
sobre el suelo algo desconcertada,
incapaz de dar un paso más.

—¡Mira! ¡Mira!
PictureBookChapter3_Page2_001.EuSpanish:
—¡Vaya mala pata! Aquí no está
tu mamá.

Dicho esto, la chica se sentó sobre
el suelo algo desconcertada.

—¡Mira! ¡Mira!
PictureBookChapter3_Page2_001.EuGerman:
"Schade, hier scheint deine Mama
auch nicht zu sein."
Das Mädchen ließ sich plumps auf
seinen Hosenboden fallen und blieb
erst mal sitzen.
"Sieh mal!!!", rief Luma auf einmal.
PictureBookChapter3_Page2_001.EuItalian:
"Che peccato! Sembra che la mamma
non sia qui..." disse la giovane,
sedendosi per terra affaticata
e delusa.
PictureBookChapter3_Page2_001.JpJapanese:
[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]は、ペタンとおしりをついて[ruby base]座[ruby top]すわ[ruby end]り[ruby base]込[ruby top]こ[ruby end]みました。
「[ruby base]残念[ruby top]ざんねん[ruby end]ね、ここにママは、いないみたい。」


「[ruby base]見[ruby top]み[ruby end]て！」
PictureBookChapter3_Page2_001.KrKorean:
여자 아이는 털썩하고 주저앉았습니다.
「여기에는 엄마가 없나 봐.」

「저길 봐!」

PictureBookChapter3_Page3_000.UsEnglish:
Peering down at the icy ground
where Luma was pointing, the girl
suddenly noticed clusters of
Star Bits encased in the ice.

"Pretty good, huh? Finding Star Bits
is my specialty!" said Luma, beaming.
PictureBookChapter3_Page3_000.EuEnglish:
Peering down at the icy ground
where Luma was pointing, the girl
suddenly noticed clusters of
Star Bits encased in the ice.

"Pretty good, huh? Finding Star Bits
is my specialty!" said Luma, beaming.
PictureBookChapter3_Page3_000.EuDutch:
Peering down at the icy ground
where Luma was pointing, the girl
suddenly noticed clusters of
Star Bits encased in the ice.

"Pretty good, huh? Finding Star Bits
is my specialty!" said Luma, beaming.
PictureBookChapter3_Page3_000.UsFrench:
Elle regarda le sol gelé que lui
montrait Chiko et vit que de
nombreux Éclats d'Étoile y étaient
gelés.

"C'est formidable, hein? Trouver
des Éclats d'Étoile, c'est ma
spécialité!" dit Chiko fièrement.
PictureBookChapter3_Page3_000.EuFrench:
Dans l'épaisseur du sol gelé que lui
montrait le Luma, la fillette aperçut
de nombreux éclats d'étoiles!
"C'est formidable, hein?!" dit
fièrement le Luma.
PictureBookChapter3_Page3_000.UsSpanish:
Destello se fijo en el hielo de la
superficie y descubrió varios
Trozos de Estrellas.

—¿Qué te parece? ¡Encontrar Trozos
de Estrella es mi especialidad!

Destello estaba radiante.
PictureBookChapter3_Page3_000.EuSpanish:
El destello se fijó en el hielo de la
superficie y descubrió polvo de
estrellas desperdigado por todos
lados.

—¿A que soy un genio? —dijo
radiante—.
PictureBookChapter3_Page3_000.EuGerman:
Unter der Eisoberfläche, auf die
Luma aufgeregt zeigte, war doch
tatsächlich eine Menge Sternenstaub
eingeschlossen.
"Klasse, oder?!?"
Luma schien stolz zu sein.
PictureBookChapter3_Page3_000.EuItalian:
"Ehi! Guarda!"
Sul terreno gelato indicato da
Sfavillotto si trovavano tan-
tissime Astroschegge!
"Che bello!" urlò Sfavillotto
tutto orgoglioso per la scoperta.
PictureBookChapter3_Page3_000.JpJapanese:
チコが[ruby base]指[ruby top]さ[ruby end]す[ruby base]氷[ruby top]こおり[ruby end]の[ruby base]地面[ruby top]じめん[ruby end]を[ruby base]見[ruby top]み[ruby end]ると
そこには、たくさんの[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]くずが、[ruby base]埋[ruby top]う[ruby end]まっていました。

「すごいでしょ。」
チコは、[ruby base]得意[ruby top]とくい[ruby end]げです。
PictureBookChapter3_Page3_000.KrKorean:
치코가 가리키는 얼음 바닥에는
수많은 별들이 묻혀 있었습니다.

「대단하지?」
치코는 의기양양하게 말했습니다.

PictureBookChapter3_Page3_001.UsEnglish:
"There's ice here, but it's so warm,
I'll bet there's water here too."

The two decided to stay on the
comet for a while.
PictureBookChapter3_Page3_001.EuEnglish:
"There's ice here, but it's so warm,
I'll bet there's water here too."

The two decided to stay on the
comet for a while.
PictureBookChapter3_Page3_001.EuDutch:
"There's ice here, but it's so warm,
I'll bet there's water here too."

The two decided to stay on the
comet for a while.
PictureBookChapter3_Page3_001.UsFrench:
"Il y a de la glace ici, mais la
température est très agréable.
Je gage qu'il y a de l'eau aussi!"

Les deux décidèrent de s'installer
quelque temps sur la comète.
PictureBookChapter3_Page3_001.EuFrench:
"Même si cet astre est fait de glace,
la température y est très agréable!
Et je suis sûr qu'on peut y trouver
de l'eau!"
D'un commun accord, ils décidèrent
de s'installer quelque temps dans ce
nouveau paradis.
PictureBookChapter3_Page3_001.UsSpanish:
—Aquí hay mucho hielo, pero
también es muy cálido. Además,
seguro que también encontramos
agua. Es un paraíso.

Tras pensarlo, decidieron vivir allí
durante un tiempo.
PictureBookChapter3_Page3_001.EuSpanish:
—Aquí hay mucho hielo, pero hace
un calorcín muy agradable. Además,
seguro que también encontramos
agua. Es un paraíso —dijo ella—.

Tras pensarlo un rato, finalmente
decidieron vivir allí durante un
tiempo.
PictureBookChapter3_Page3_001.EuGerman:
"Hier ist es trotz des Eises warm,
beinahe wie im Paradies. Und
Wasser gibt es hier auch!"

Die beiden entschlossen sich, für
eine Weile auf diesem Stern zu
bleiben.
PictureBookChapter3_Page3_001.EuItalian:
"Anche se questa cometa è ghiaccia-
ta, fa caldo e c'è persino dell'acqua!
Si direbbe quasi un paradiso!"
Così i due amici decisero di
fermarsi a vivere lì per un po'.
PictureBookChapter3_Page3_001.JpJapanese:
「ここは、[ruby base]氷[ruby top]こおり[ruby end]があるのに[ruby base]暖[ruby top]あたた[ruby end]かいし、まるで[ruby base]天国[ruby top]てんごく[ruby end]ね。
　おまけに、[ruby base]水[ruby top]みず[ruby end]も[ruby base]手[ruby top]て[ruby end]に[ruby base]入[ruby top]はい[ruby end]りそう。」

[ruby base]二人[ruby top]ふたり[ruby end]は、しばらく　この[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]で[ruby base]暮[ruby top]く[ruby end]らすことにしました。
PictureBookChapter3_Page3_001.KrKorean:
「이곳은 얼음 별이지만 따뜻해서 마치 천국 같아.
 게다가 물도 있잖아.」

그들은 며칠 동안 그 별에서 생활하기로 했습니다.

PictureBookChapter3_Page3_002.UsEnglish:
Riding the turquoise comet, the
pair continued their search for
Luma's mother.
PictureBookChapter3_Page3_002.EuEnglish:
Riding the turquoise comet, the
pair continued their search for
Luma's mother.

Riding the turquoise comet, the

Se laissant porter par la comète

Ainsi, se laissant porter par le

Los dos continuaron buscando a la

A cavallo della cometa, i due

[ruby base]光[ruby top]ひか[ruby end]る[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]が、ただようにまかせ
ママを[ruby base]探[ruby top]さが[ruby end]す　[ruby base]二人[ruby top]ふたり[ruby end]の[ruby base]旅[ruby top]たび[ruby end]はつづきました。

반짝이는 별에 몸을 맡기며

[ruby base]第三章[ruby top]だいさんしょう[ruby end]

PictureBookChapter4_Page1_000.UsEnglish:
One night, the girl dreamed about
her own mother.

"Where are you going?" she asked
her mother's retreating back.

One night, the girl dreamed about
her own mother.

"Where are you going?" she asked
her mother's retreating back.

Un soir, la fillette rêva de sa propre
mère.

"Où vas-tu?" demanda-t-elle à sa
mère qui lui tournait le dos.
PictureBookChapter4_Page1_000.EuFrench:

"Où vas-tu, maman?" demanda-t-elle

Una noche, la muchacha soñó con su
madre.

—¿Adónde vas?

La muchacha preguntó mientras su
madre estaba de espaldas.

Aquella noche, la chica tuvo un

—¿Mamá? ¿Dónde vas?

Preguntó la chica a escasos pasos

Das Mädchen hatte einen Traum.
Von seiner eigenen Mama.
"Mama, wo gehst du hin?"
Die Mama kehrte ihm den Rücken zu.

La mamma apparve in sogno alla

PictureBookChapter4_Page1_000.JpJapanese:
[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]は　[ruby base]夢[ruby top]ゆめ[ruby end]をみました。ママの[ruby base]夢[ruby top]ゆめ[ruby end]です。

[ruby base]後[ruby top]うし[ruby end]ろ[ruby base]姿[ruby top]すがた[ruby end]のママに[ruby base]向[ruby top]む[ruby end]かって　そう[ruby base]聞[ruby top]き[ruby end]くと

여자 아이는 꿈을 꾸었습니다. 엄마 꿈이었습니다.

뒷모습을 보이는 엄마에게 묻자

PictureBookChapter4_Page1_001.UsEnglish:
Without turning, her mother replied,
"Don't fret, dearest. I'm not going
anywhere. I'm always watching over
you, like the sun in the day and the
moon in the night."
PictureBookChapter4_Page1_001.EuEnglish:
Without turning, her mother replied,
"Don't fret, dearest. I'm not going
anywhere. I'm always watching over
you, like the sun in the day and the

PictureBookChapter4_Page1_001.UsFrench:
Sans se retourner, sa mère lui

PictureBookChapter4_Page1_001.EuFrench:
Sans se retourner, sa mère lui

"Ne crains rien, je ne t'abandonne

Su madre habló sin voltearse:

—No voy a ninguna parte. Siempre
estaré observándote. Por el día seré
el sol, y por la noche seré la luna.
Siempre estaré velando por ti.

Siempre estaré observándote. Por el

PictureBookChapter4_Page1_001.JpJapanese:
ママは、そのまま[ruby base]背[ruby top]せ[ruby end]をむけて　こう[ruby base]返事[ruby top]へんじ[ruby end]をしました。

　[ruby base]昼[ruby top]ひる[ruby end]には、[ruby base]太陽[ruby top]たいよう[ruby end]となって、[ruby base]夜[ruby top]よる[ruby end]には、[ruby base]月[ruby top]つき[ruby end]となって　
　いつも、あなたを[ruby base]見[ruby top]み[ruby end]ているわ。」

엄마는 뒷모습을 보인 채로 대답했습니다.

PictureBookChapter4_Page2_000.UsEnglish:
A wave of sadness washed over
the girl.

"What about when it rains, and I
can't see the sun or the moon?"

Her mother thought for a moment
before responding.
PictureBookChapter4_Page2_000.EuEnglish:
A wave of sadness washed over
the girl.

"What about when it rains, and I
can't see the sun or the moon?"

Her mother thought for a moment
before responding.

A wave of sadness washed over
the girl.

"What about when it rains, and I
can't see the sun or the moon?"

Her mother thought for a moment
before responding.
PictureBookChapter4_Page2_000.UsFrench:
La fillette, accablée de tristesse,
lui demanda: "Et les nuits pluvieuses,
où il n'y a ni soleil ni lune?"

Sa mère réfléchit un instant et
répondit:
PictureBookChapter4_Page2_000.EuFrench:
Une vague de tristesse s'abattit sur
la fillette:
"Et comment feras-tu lors des nuits
pluvieuses, où il n'y a ni soleil,
ni lune?"
Après quelques instants de
réflexion, sa mère répondit:
PictureBookChapter4_Page2_000.UsSpanish:
De repente, la muchacha entristeció.

—¿Qué ocurrirá los días de lluvia,
cuando no pueda ver el sol ni la
luna?

Su madre permaneció pensativa un
momento y contestó...
PictureBookChapter4_Page2_000.EuSpanish:
Una amarga tristeza se apoderó de

—¿Y los días sin sol ni luna?
En ellos no me podrás ver.

Su madre permaneció pensativa un
momento y contestó.
PictureBookChapter4_Page2_000.EuGerman:
Das Mädchen wurde so traurig, es

"Und wenn es regnet und weder
Sonne noch Mond zu sehen sind?"

La giovane si rattristò e continuò:
"E quando non si vede il sole, né

La mamma pensò un po', poi rispose.
PictureBookChapter4_Page2_000.JpJapanese:
[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]は、たまらなく[ruby base]悲[ruby top]かな[ruby end]しくなって[ruby base]聞[ruby top]き[ruby end]きました。
「[ruby base]太陽[ruby top]たいよう[ruby end]も[ruby base]月[ruby top]つき[ruby end]もない、[ruby base]雨[ruby top]あめ[ruby end]の[ruby base]日[ruby top]ひ[ruby end]の[ruby base]夜[ruby top]よる[ruby end]は？」

ママは、すこし[ruby base]考[ruby top]かんが[ruby end]えると[ruby base]答[ruby top]こた[ruby end]えました。
PictureBookChapter4_Page2_000.KrKorean:
여자 아이는 갑자기 슬퍼졌습니다.
「태양도 달도 없는 비 오는 날 밤에는?」

엄마는 잠시 생각하고는 이렇게 말했습니다.

PictureBookChapter4_Page3_000.UsEnglish:
"I will turn into a star in the clouds
and wait for your tears to dry."
PictureBookChapter4_Page3_000.EuEnglish:
"I will turn into a star in the clouds
and wait for your tears to dry."
PictureBookChapter4_Page3_000.EuDutch:
"I will turn into a star in the clouds
and wait for your tears to dry."
PictureBookChapter4_Page3_000.UsFrench:
"Je me changerai en une étoile parmi
les nuages et j'attendrai que tes 
larmes se sèchent."
PictureBookChapter4_Page3_000.EuFrench:
"Je me changerai en étoile et
j'attendrai, par-delà les nuages,
que tu arrêtes de pleurer."
PictureBookChapter4_Page3_000.UsSpanish:
—Esos días, seré una estrella que 
espere por el fin de tus llantos
sobre una nube.
PictureBookChapter4_Page3_000.EuSpanish:
—Esos días, seré estrella que aguarde
el fin de tus llantos sobre una nube.
PictureBookChapter4_Page3_000.EuGerman:
Die Mama antwortete mit einem
Lächeln:
"Dann werde ich ein Stern und warte
über den Wolken, bis du aufhörst
zu weinen."
PictureBookChapter4_Page3_000.EuItalian:
"In forma di stella, da sopra
le nuvole, attendo che tu smetta

PictureBookChapter4_Page3_000.JpJapanese:
「お[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end][ruby base]様[ruby top]さま[ruby end]になって、[ruby base]雲[ruby top]くも[ruby end]のうえで
　あなたが、[ruby base]泣[ruby top]な[ruby end]き[ruby base]止[ruby top]や[ruby end]むのを[ruby base]待[ruby top]ま[ruby end]っているわ。」
PictureBookChapter4_Page3_000.KrKorean:
「별이 되어 구름 위에서
 네가 울음을 그치기를 기다리고 있단다.」

PictureBookChapter4_Page4_000.UsEnglish:
When she awoke, the girl's face was
damp with tears.

"You have Star Bits in your eyes!"
said Luma to the girl.
PictureBookChapter4_Page4_000.EuEnglish:
When she awoke, the girl's face was
damp with tears.

"You have Star Bits in your eyes!"
said Luma to the girl.
PictureBookChapter4_Page4_000.EuDutch:
When she awoke, the girl's face was
damp with tears.

"You have Star Bits in your eyes!"
said Luma to the girl.
PictureBookChapter4_Page4_000.UsFrench:
Quand elle se réveilla, la fillette
avait les yeux mouillés de larmes.

"Tu as des Éclats d'Étoile coulant
de tes yeux!" lui dit Chiko.
PictureBookChapter4_Page4_000.EuFrench:
A son réveil, la fillette avait les
yeux mouillés de larmes.
Le Luma, allongé à ses côtés,
demanda:
"Pourquoi est-ce que des éclats
d'étoiles coulent de tes yeux?"
Essuyant ses larmes, la fillette
répondit:
PictureBookChapter4_Page4_000.UsSpanish:
Al despertar, la muchacha tenía los
ojos bañados en lágrimas. Destello
se acercó y le dijo:

—Tienes toda la cara llena de
Trozos de Estrellas.
PictureBookChapter4_Page4_000.EuSpanish:
Al despertar, la chica tenía los ojos
bañados en lágrimas. El destello se
arrimó y le dijo:

—Tienes la cara llena de
polvo de estrellas.

Ella se frotó los ojos.

Als es aufwachte, waren die Augen

der sich an es schmiegte, sagte:
"Aus deinen Augen fließt
Sternenstaub."
Das Mädchen trocknete sich

Al risveglio, la ragazza aveva

Sfavillotto notò:
"Ti scendono Astroschegge

La giovane s'asciugò il viso.
PictureBookChapter4_Page4_000.JpJapanese:
[ruby base]目覚[ruby top]めざ[ruby end]めると、[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]の[ruby base]目[ruby top]め[ruby end]は[ruby base]涙[ruby top]なみだ[ruby end]でぬれていました。
そばに[ruby base]寄[ruby top]よ[ruby end]りそっていた　チコが[ruby base]聞[ruby top]き[ruby end]きました。

「[ruby base]目[ruby top]め[ruby end]から[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]くずが　ながれているよ。」
[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]は、[ruby base]涙[ruby top]なみだ[ruby end]をぬぐって[ruby base]言[ruby top]い[ruby end]いました。
PictureBookChapter4_Page4_000.KrKorean:
잠에서 깨어난 여자 아이의 눈은
눈물로 젖어 있었습니다.
옆으로 다가온 치코가 물었습니다.
「눈에서 별이 떨어지고 있어.」
여자 아이는 눈물을 닦으며 말했습니다.

PictureBookChapter4_Page4_001.UsEnglish:
Wiping her face, the girl replied,
"These are tears, not Star Bits. I'm
crying because I'll never see my
mother ever again!"

At this, Luma began to cry too.
"Mama, oh, Mama... Waaaah!"
PictureBookChapter4_Page4_001.EuEnglish:
Wiping her face, the girl replied,
"These are tears, not Star Bits. I'm
crying because I'll never see my
mother ever again!"

At this, Luma began to cry too.
"Mama, oh, Mama... Waaaah!"
PictureBookChapter4_Page4_001.EuDutch:
Wiping her face, the girl replied,
"These are tears, not Star Bits. I'm
crying because I'll never see my
mother ever again!"

At this, Luma began to cry too.
"Mama, oh, Mama... Waaaah!"
PictureBookChapter4_Page4_001.UsFrench:
Essuyant ses larmes, la fillette lui 
répondit, "Ce sont des larmes, pas 
des Éclats d'Étoile. Je pleure car je 
ne reverrai jamais ma mère!"

À ces mots, ce fut Chiko qui se mit 
à pleurer. "Maman, ô Maman... 
Waaah!"
PictureBookChapter4_Page4_001.EuFrench:
"Malheureusement, ce ne sont pas
des éclats d'étoiles. Je pleure parce
que je ne reverrai jamais ma
maman."
Le Luma se mit à pleurer à son tour.
"Maman... maman..."
PictureBookChapter4_Page4_001.UsSpanish:
—¡Son lágrimas, no Trozos de
Estrellas! ¡Estoy llorando porque
nunca volveré a ver a mi madre!

Al oír eso, Destello también comenzó
a llorar. 

—Mamá, mamá...
PictureBookChapter4_Page4_001.EuSpanish:
—¡No es polvo de estrellas!
¡Son lágrimas! ¡Estoy llorando porque
ya no voy a poder ver a mi madre!

Sus palabras desembocaron en
los llantos del destello.

—Mamá... Mamá...
PictureBookChapter4_Page4_001.EuGerman:
"Das ist kein Sternenstaub. So schön
sind Tränen nicht. Wenn mein Traum
stimmt, werden wir unsere Mamas
nie wiedersehen."
Dieses Mal fing Luma an zu weinen.

"Mama... Mama..."
PictureBookChapter4_Page4_001.EuItalian:
"Non sono belle come le
Astroschegge... Adesso so
che non vedremo mai più
le nostre mamme."
Stavolta fu Sfavillotto a piangere.
"Mamma... Mamma..."
PictureBookChapter4_Page4_001.JpJapanese:
「[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]くずじゃないわ。そんなに、きれいなものじゃない。
　ああ、これじゃママに[ruby base]会[ruby top]あ[ruby end]えなくなってしまう。」
[ruby base]今度[ruby top]こんど[ruby end]は、チコが[ruby base]泣[ruby top]な[ruby end]き[ruby base]出[ruby top]だ[ruby end]しました。

「ママ・・・ママ・・・」

「별이 아니야. 이건 그렇게 예쁜 게 아니야.
 이대로라면 엄마를 못 만날지도 몰라.」
이번엔 치코가 울기 시작했습니다.

「엄마… 엄마….」

PictureBookChapter4_Page5_000.UsEnglish:
The pair traveled through the starry
skies, and though they encountered
many other comets, not one of them
held Luma's mother.

Luma was despondent.
PictureBookChapter4_Page5_000.EuEnglish:
The pair traveled through the starry
skies, and though they encountered
many other comets, not one of them
held Luma's mother.

Luma was despondent.

The pair traveled through the starry
skies, and though they encountered
many other comets, not one of them
held Luma's mother.

Luma was despondent.
PictureBookChapter4_Page5_000.UsFrench:
Au cours de leur voyage dans le ciel
étoilé, ils croisèrent de nombreuses
comètes; mais aucune d'elles
n'hébergeait la mère de Chiko.
PictureBookChapter4_Page5_000.EuFrench:
Ils avaient croisé de nombreuses
comètes au cours de leur périple
intergalactique, mais aucune d'elles
n'avait été celle de la maman du
Luma.

Viajaron sobre el cometa a través
del cielo estrellado, y aunque
encontraron muchos otros cometas,

Atravesaron una y otra vez el

Viaggiando per l'oceano stellato vi-

PictureBookChapter4_Page5_000.JpJapanese:
[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]の[ruby base]海[ruby top]うみ[ruby end]を[ruby base]旅[ruby top]たび[ruby end]して、いくつもの　ほうき[ruby base]星[ruby top]ぼし[ruby end]と[ruby base]出会[ruby top]であ[ruby end]っても
チコのママは、[ruby base]見[ruby top]み[ruby end]つかりませんでした。
PictureBookChapter4_Page5_000.KrKorean:
별의 바다를 여행하며 몇 개의 별똥별을 만났지만
치코의 엄마는 어디에도 없었습니다.

PictureBookChapter4_Page5_001.UsEnglish:
"Now, now, Luma. The rain clouds
won't go away if you keep crying,"
the girl said, giving Luma a squeeze.
"I'll give you a present if you stop."
PictureBookChapter4_Page5_001.EuEnglish:
"Now, now, Luma. The rain clouds
won't go away if you keep crying,"
the girl said, giving Luma a squeeze.
"I'll give you a present if you stop."
PictureBookChapter4_Page5_001.EuDutch:
"Now, now, Luma. The rain clouds
won't go away if you keep crying,"
the girl said, giving Luma a squeeze.
"I'll give you a present if you stop."
PictureBookChapter4_Page5_001.UsFrench:
"Allez, arrête de pleurer, Chiko. 
Sinon, les nuages de pluie ne 
partiront pas," lui dit la fillette en 
le serrant tendrement dans ses bras.

her care, she'd been bustling about
at a feverish pace.

"It's a lot of work, but it's worth it
to make a happy home."

unlike any they had ever seen, and

planet appeared on the horizon.

그런데 살구색 작은 별이 천천히 다가왔습니다.

PictureBookChapter6_Page1_001.UsEnglish:
From the planet, another Luma of
the same color emerged.

"Do you two know each other?!"
the girl asked the two Lumas
gleefully. Despite the girl's
excitement, they seemed uneasy.

From the planet, another Luma of

"Do you two know each other?!"
the girl asked the two Lumas

De cette planète apparut un Chiko

"Vous connaissez-vous?!" demanda

Allí vivía un ser igual que su

La muchacha dijo emocionada:

Allí vivía un ser semejante a su

La chica se alegró mucho por la

Aber Luma schien etwas besorgt.

Su quel pianeta abitavano altri

[ruby base]突然[ruby top]とつぜん[ruby end]の[ruby base]訪問[ruby top]ほうもん[ruby end]に、[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]はとても[ruby base]喜[ruby top]よろこ[ruby end]びましたが

그 별에는 치코의 친구들이 살고 있었습니다.

여자 아이는 기뻤지만

PictureBookChapter6_Page2_000.UsEnglish:
The two Lumas neither drew closer
nor backed away from each other.
Instead, they just stared.

Then one Luma broke the silence.
PictureBookChapter6_Page2_000.EuEnglish:
The two Lumas neither drew closer
nor backed away from each other.
Instead, they just stared.

Then one Luma broke the silence.

The two Lumas neither drew closer

Les deux Chikos se dévisagèrent
longuement sans s'approcher ni
s'éloigner l'un de l'autre.

Le nouvel arrivant était de couleur

Los dos pequeños se observaban

Die beiden Luma näherten sich nicht,

I due Sfavillotti rimasero immobili a

PictureBookChapter6_Page2_000.JpJapanese:
[ruby base]降[ruby top]お[ruby end]りてきたチコは、[ruby base]住[ruby top]す[ruby end]んでいる[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]と[ruby base]同[ruby top]おな[ruby end]じオレンジ[ruby base]色[ruby top]いろ[ruby end]。
[ruby base]二人[ruby top]ふたり[ruby end]のチコは、[ruby base]寄[ruby top]よ[ruby end]るわけでもなく、[ruby base]離[ruby top]はな[ruby end]れるわけでもなく
じっと、[ruby base]相手[ruby top]あいて[ruby end]をみつめています。

별에서 내려온 치코는

두 치코는 서로 다가가지도 않고 멀어지지도 않고

PictureBookChapter6_Page2_002.UsEnglish:
At once, the apricot Luma parroted
back, "My mama! My mama!"
PictureBookChapter6_Page2_002.EuEnglish:
At once, the apricot Luma parroted
back, "My mama! My mama!"
PictureBookChapter6_Page2_002.EuDutch:
At once, the apricot Luma parroted
back, "My mama! My mama!"

À ces mots, le Chiko couleur abricot

ma maman! C'est ma maman!"
PictureBookChapter6_Page2_002.EuFrench:
dit le Luma, rompant le silence.
Ce à quoi le Luma orange, tel un
perroquet, répliqua:

Al momento, el Destello de color
albaricoque respondió como un eco:

—¡Mi mamá! ¡Mi mamá!

Al oír esto, el destello naranja
respondió inmediatamente
como si fuera un papagayo.

Luma genau diesen Satz:

"Das ist meine Mama!"
Die beiden wirbelten im Kreis

Appena Sfavillotto disse ciò, lo Sfa-

[ruby base]突然[ruby top]とつぜん[ruby end]、チコが[ruby base]切[ruby top]き[ruby end]り[ruby base]出[ruby top]だ[ruby end]すと、オレンジ[ruby base]色[ruby top]いろ[ruby end]のチコも
オウム[ruby base]返[ruby top]がえ[ruby end]しのように[ruby base]答[ruby top]こた[ruby end]えました。

치코가 이렇게 말하자 오렌지색 치코도

PictureBookChapter6_Page2_003.EuGerman:
"Das ist meine Mama!!!"

"Das ist meine Mama!!!"
PictureBookChapter6_Page2_003.EuItalian:
"È la mia mamma!"
"È la mia mamma!"
PictureBookChapter6_Page2_003.JpJapanese: 「ボクの　ママだ！！」　「ボクの　ママだ！！」

PictureBookChapter6_Page2_004.UsEnglish:
The two Lumas began to dance
around the girl frantically, and
neither showed any sign of stopping.
PictureBookChapter6_Page2_004.EuEnglish:
The two Lumas began to dance
around the girl frantically, and
neither showed any sign of stopping.

The two Lumas began to dance
around the girl frantically, and

Les deux Chikos se mirent à danser

Chacun des Luma tirait la fillette de

[ruby base]二人[ruby top]ふたり[ruby end]とも、[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]の[ruby base]頭[ruby top]あたま[ruby end]をひっぱって
どちらも　ゆずらず、といった[ruby base]感[ruby top]かん[ruby end]じです。
PictureBookChapter6_Page2_004.KrKorean:
두 치코는 여자 아이를 잡아당기기 시작했습니다.
둘 다 양보할 마음이 없나 봅니다.

PictureBookChapter6_Page2_005.UsEnglish:
The girl was so charmed by this
adorable scene that she couldn't
help but laugh.

And that's when something very
strange happened.

The girl was so charmed by this
adorable scene that she couldn't
help but laugh.

And that's when something very
strange happened.

The girl was so charmed by this

help but laugh.

And that's when something very
strange happened.

Cet échange était si mignon, que la

C'est alors que quelque chose de

Leur naïve dispute offrait un

Justo en ese momento...

Weil dieser Wortwechsel nur allzu

Es musste beinahe laut lachen.

Ciò che stava succedendo era così

そのやり[ruby base]取[ruby top]と[ruby end]りが　あまりに、かわいいので
[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]は、おかしくてしかたがありません。

[ruby base]笑[ruby top]わら[ruby end]い[ruby base]出[ruby top]だ[ruby end]しそうになった、その[ruby base]時[ruby top]とき[ruby end]です。

그들의 대화가 너무나 귀엽고 재밌어서

웃음을 터뜨리려던 찰나.

Suddenly, more Lumas began to pop
out from the apricot planet. They
were different colors, but they all
shouted the same thing.

"My mama!" "My mama!"

Suddenly, more Lumas began to pop
out from the apricot planet. They

"My mama!" "My mama!"

out from the apricot planet. They

Tout à coup, une foule de Chikos

"C'est ma maman! C'est ma maman!"

¡De aquel astro naranja comenzaron

Rosafarbene, blaue, orange, gelbe

アプリコットの[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]から、あとから　あとから

[ruby base]赤[ruby top]あか[ruby end]、[ruby base]青[ruby top]あお[ruby end]、オレンジ[ruby base]色[ruby top]いろ[ruby end]に[ruby base]緑[ruby top]みどり[ruby end]もいます。

「ボクの　ママだ！！」「ボクの　ママだ！！」「ボクの　ママだ！！」

살구 별에서 꼬리에 꼬리를 물고

PictureBookChapter6_Page3_001.UsEnglish:
The sight of all the shouting Lumas
only made the girl laugh harder.
"What am I going to do with all
these children?!"

The Lumas just stared blankly as
she doubled over laughing.

The sight of all the shouting Lumas
only made the girl laugh harder.
"What am I going to do with all
these children?!"

The Lumas just stared blankly as
she doubled over laughing.

The sight of all the shouting Lumas
only made the girl laugh harder.
"What am I going to do with all
these children?!"

The Lumas just stared blankly as
she doubled over laughing.

À mesure que les voix de tous les 
Chikos résonnaient, la fillette riait 
même plus fort. "Qu'est-ce que je 
vais faire avec tous ces enfants?!"

Les Chikos, perplexes, regardèrent

A mesure que les voix de tous ces
Luma s'amplifiaient, la fillette avait

N'y tenant plus, elle s'esclaffa:

Al ver los Destellos gritando, la

—¡¿Qué voy a hacer con todos estos

Los Destellos la miraban, confusos,

La gran cantidad de destellos que

—Aquí tenemos un problema enorme.

Wie die zahlreichen Luma so mit

Die Luma betrachteten verblüfft das

Più gli Sfavillotti pronunciavano

おおぜいのチコが、[ruby base]声[ruby top]こえ[ruby end]をそろえると
ますます[ruby base]笑[ruby top]わら[ruby end]いが、[ruby base]込[ruby top]こ[ruby end]み[ruby base]上[ruby top]あ[ruby end]げてきました。
「[ruby base]困[ruby top]こま[ruby end]ったわ。こんなにたくさん、こどもが[ruby base]増[ruby top]ふ[ruby end]えて。」

여러 명의 치코가 한목소리를 내자

PictureBookChapter6_Page3_002.UsEnglish:
"I guess we'll have to name each and
every one of you."
PictureBookChapter6_Page3_002.EuEnglish:
"I guess we'll have to name each and
every one of you."
PictureBookChapter6_Page3_002.EuDutch:
"I guess we'll have to name each and
every one of you."
PictureBookChapter6_Page3_002.UsFrench:
"Je suppose qu'on devra choisir un 
nom pour chacun d'entre vous."
PictureBookChapter6_Page3_002.EuFrench:
Les Luma, perplexes, regardaient la
fillette qui riait en se tenant le
ventre. Lorsqu'elle finit par se

"Okay, dann will ich mal jedem von

La ragazza disse: "Non vi

PictureBookChapter6_Page3_002.JpJapanese:
[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]は、[ruby base]言[ruby top]い[ruby end]いました。
「いいわ、ひとりひとり[ruby base]名前[ruby top]なまえ[ruby end]をつけていきましょう。」
PictureBookChapter6_Page3_002.KrKorean:
여자 아이가 말했습니다.
「좋아! 한 명 한 명 이름을 지어 줄게.」

PictureBookChapter6_Page3_003.UsEnglish:
Tomorrow, once she had finished
naming them all, she would begin
moving all the Lumas into the
new house.
PictureBookChapter6_Page3_003.EuEnglish:
Tomorrow, once she had finished
naming them all, she would begin
moving all the Lumas into the
new house.

PictureBookChapter7_Page1_000.UsEnglish:
After seeing their 100th comet, a
sudden thought popped into the
girl's head: "I wonder if my home
planet is still as blue as it was."
PictureBookChapter7_Page1_000.EuEnglish:
After seeing their 100th comet, a
sudden thought popped into the
girl's head: "I wonder if my home
planet is still as blue as it was."
PictureBookChapter7_Page1_000.EuDutch:
After seeing their 100th comet, a
sudden thought popped into the
girl's head: "I wonder if my home
planet is still as blue as it was."
PictureBookChapter7_Page1_000.UsFrench:
Alors qu'une centième comète
passait sous les yeux, une pensée
vint à l'esprit de la fillette: "La
planète où je suis née, a-t-elle

Alors qu'une centième comète
passait à proximité, la fillette pensa:
"Je me demande si ma planète a
toujours le même éclat bleu..."

Después de ver el cometa número
cien, la muchacha pensó de repente:

—Me pregunto si el planeta en el
que nací todavía tiene un brillo azul.

Justo cuando pasó el cometa número
cien, la chica tuvo un pensamiento:

—¿Seguirá brillando igual
de azul mi planeta natal?

Als der 100. Komet an ihnen vorbei-
gezogen war, dachte das Mädchen:
"Ob der Stern, auf dem ich geboren
wurde, immer noch blau erstrahlt?"

Quando videro la centesima cometa,

[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]は[ruby base]思[ruby top]おも[ruby end]いました。
「わたしの[ruby base]生[ruby top]う[ruby end]まれた[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]は、[ruby base]今[ruby top]いま[ruby end]も[ruby base]青[ruby top]あお[ruby end]く[ruby base]光[ruby top]ひか[ruby end]っているのかしら？」

100개째의 별똥별이 지나갈 때

「내가 태어난 별은 지금도 파랗게 빛나고 있을까?」

That's when she remembered her 
father's telescope.
PictureBookChapter7_Page1_001.EuEnglish:
That's when she remembered her 
father's telescope.

That's when she remembered her

C'est alors qu'elle se souvint du

Elle se souvint tout d'un coup du

En ese momento recordó que tenía

PictureBookChapter7_Page1_001.EuSpanish:
De repente, se acordó del

PictureBookChapter7_Page2_000.UsEnglish:
Peeking into the telescope, a tiny
blue dot floated into sight. It was
smaller than a Star Bit.

"How strange... It's so far away, but
it feels so close."
PictureBookChapter7_Page2_000.EuEnglish:
Peeking into the telescope, a tiny
blue dot floated into sight. It was
smaller than a Star Bit.

"How strange... It's so far away, but
it feels so close."
PictureBookChapter7_Page2_000.EuDutch:
Peeking into the telescope, a tiny
blue dot floated into sight. It was
smaller than a Star Bit.

"How strange... It's so far away, but
it feels so close."
PictureBookChapter7_Page2_000.UsFrench:
En regardant dans le téléscope, un
minuscule point bleu apparut. Il était
plus petit qu'un Éclat d'Étoile.
"Comme c'est étrange... Elle est si
loin, mais je la sens très proche."
PictureBookChapter7_Page2_000.EuFrench:
A travers l'objectif du télescope,
elle vit au loin sa toute petite
planète bleue, plus petite qu'un éclat
d'étoile.
"C'est étrange... Elle est si loin,
et pourtant je la sens si proche."
PictureBookChapter7_Page2_000.UsSpanish:
Observando con el telescopio vio
un pequeño planeta azul. Era aún
más pequeño que un Trozo de
Estrella.

—Qué extraño. Está muy lejos, pero
lo siento muy, muy cerca.
PictureBookChapter7_Page2_000.EuSpanish:
Miró a través de él, y encontró una
minúscula estrella azul. Era incluso
menor que el polvo de estrellas,
pero pensó:

—Está muy lejos, pero la siento
muy, muy cerca.
PictureBookChapter7_Page2_000.EuGerman:
Als es durch Papas Teleskop blickte,
war da ein winziger blauer Stern.
Kleiner als Sternenstaub. Als das
Mädchen den Stern sah, dachte es:
"Seltsam... Er ist so fern, und doch
fühlt es sich so nah an."
PictureBookChapter7_Page2_000.EuItalian:
Osservando con il telescopio, scorse
nei cieli un minuscolo pianeta azzur-
ro. Pensò che fosse addirittura più
piccolo di un'Astroscheggia.
"Che strano... Pur essendo lontano,
sembra così vicino!"
PictureBookChapter7_Page2_000.JpJapanese:
パパの[ruby base]望遠鏡[ruby top]ぼうえんきょう[ruby end]をのぞくと

[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]くずより[ruby base]小[ruby top]ちい[ruby end]さい、その[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]を[ruby base]見[ruby top]み[ruby end]て、[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]は[ruby base]思[ruby top]おも[ruby end]いました。

「ふしぎ・・こんなに[ruby base]遠[ruby top]とお[ruby end]いのに、とても[ruby base]近[ruby top]ちか[ruby end]くに[ruby base]感[ruby top]かん[ruby end]じるわ。」
PictureBookChapter7_Page2_000.KrKorean:
아빠의 망원경 속에는 작고 파란 별이 있었습니다.
별보다 작은 그 별을 보고
여자 아이는 생각했습니다.

「신기하다… 멀리 있는데도 너무나 가깝게 느껴져.」

PictureBookChapter7_Page3_000.UsEnglish:
She twisted the knob of the
telescope, and the blue dot grew
until she could make out a grassy
hill dotted with flowers. It seemed
very familiar to her.
PictureBookChapter7_Page3_000.EuEnglish:
She twisted the knob of the
telescope, and the blue dot grew
until she could make out a grassy
hill dotted with flowers. It seemed
very familiar to her.

telescope, and the blue dot grew

hill dotted with flowers. It seemed

PictureBookChapter7_Page3_000.UsFrench:
Elle tourna la molette du téléscope,
et le point bleu devint de plus en
plus grand. Elle la tourna jusqu'à ce
qu'elle pût voir une colline herbeuse
parsemée de fleurs. Cette colline lui
semblait très familière.

En tournant la molette du télescope,

Giró el objetivo del telescopio y el
planeta azul creció y creció hasta

Siempre había guardado con cariño
el recuerdo de ese paisaje.
PictureBookChapter7_Page3_000.EuSpanish:
Giró el objetivo del telescopio y la

Siempre había atesorado con gran
cariño el recuerdo de ese paisaje.

Als es das Teleskop mit einem Ruck

immer größer und plötzlich war ein
Hügel zu sehen.
Diese Landschaft rief Erinnerungen
wach.

Girando il telescopio per mettere a

[ruby base]望遠鏡[ruby top]ぼうえんきょう[ruby end]のつまみを、クイッとひねると
[ruby base]青[ruby top]あお[ruby end]い[ruby base]星[ruby top]ほし[ruby end]は、どんどん[ruby base]大[ruby top]おお[ruby end]きくなり、とある[ruby base]丘[ruby top]おか[ruby end]を[ruby base]映[ruby top]うつ[ruby end]しました。
そこは、とても[ruby base]懐[ruby top]なつ[ruby end]かしい[ruby base]風景[ruby top]ふうけい[ruby end]でした。
PictureBookChapter7_Page3_000.KrKorean:
망원경의 나사를 돌렸더니

그곳은 너무나 그리운 곳이었습니다.

PictureBookChapter7_Page3_001.UsEnglish:
Zooming even closer, a terrace on
the hill came into view.

"I used to go stargazing there when
I lived on my home planet."
PictureBookChapter7_Page3_001.EuEnglish:
Zooming even closer, a terrace on
the hill came into view.

"I used to go stargazing there when
I lived on my home planet."

the hill came into view.

"I used to go stargazing there when

PictureBookChapter7_Page3_001.UsFrench:
Après un moment, une terrasse sur 
la colline se distingua. 

"J'y observais les étoiles quand je 
vivais sur ma planète natale."
PictureBookChapter7_Page3_001.EuFrench:
"C'est la terrasse sur laquelle je me
rendais pour observer les étoiles!"
Cette colline était très proche du
village dans lequel la fillette avait
grandi.
Ce paysage familier raviva en elle
de nombreux souvenirs.
PictureBookChapter7_Page3_001.UsSpanish:
—Solía ir allí a ver las estrellas
cuando vivía en mi planeta natal.

Estaba viendo justo la colina de
su infancia.
PictureBookChapter7_Page3_001.EuSpanish:
—¡Es el mirador de estrellas!

¡Estaba viendo justo la colina donde
correteó durante toda su infancia!
PictureBookChapter7_Page3_001.EuGerman:
"Eine Terrasse, um die Sterne
zu beobachten!" Da war der Hügel,

PictureBookChapter7_Page3_001.EuItalian:
"La Terrazza Mirastelle!"
Era la collina a ridosso del

「[ruby base]星見[ruby top]ほしみ[ruby end]のテラスだわ！」
そこは、[ruby base]女[ruby top]おんな[ruby end]の[ruby base]子[ruby top]こ[ruby end]のふるさとの[ruby base]丘[ruby top]おか[ruby end]だったのです。
PictureBookChapter7_Page3_001.KrKorean:
「별을 보던 테라스야!」
그곳은 여자 아이의 고향 언덕이었습니다.

the stars...

She remembered having picnics

Quella era la collina su cui era an-
